data.meaning_mnemonic: You keep your <radical>bow</radical> <radical>private</radical> because it's made of <radical>insect</radical>s, meaning it's extremely <kanji>strong</kanji>. Insect bodies are really durable, so they make for super strong bows. That's why you have to keep this one private — it's simply too strong to let others get ahold of.
data.meaning_hint: Imagine holding this bow. Feel how strong it is as you draw the string. Now look closely at the insect bodies it's made of. Thanks for your help, little guys.
data.reading_mnemonic: You had this <kanji>strong</kanji> bow made especially for you in <reading>きょう</reading>と. きょうと is famous for their strong bows, so if you ever want another, you know where to go.
data.reading_hint: Imagine all the people who live in きょうと, using their strong arms to make strong bows out of strong insect carapaces. Could きょうと be Japan's strongest city?
